answers.answer: The disparity between new contact lens rx and old glasses rx could be causing some of the problem.  Also - it is common to have some visual complaints after switching from contacts to glasses, anyway.  You could have eye strain from prolonged computer work, especially with contacts - but with a lower power contact, I would think near work would be more clear.  If you are around age 40 or older, then age is playing a significant role as presbyopia starts to kick in.  Dry eye syndrome could be an issue, as well as medicatiion side effects.  Consider all these things - but the glasses/contact disparity would me my first thought.Michael Kutryb, MD

question: I went for my annual eye exam about 4 months ago -- everything was great, even to the point that both my eyes had improved quite a bit.  I went from 4.75 in my right and 4.50 in my left to both being 4.25 now.  I was told that I had no sign of any eye problems or diabetes.  However, I did have astigmatism in both eyes.  I ordered my new pair of contacts and everything was fine.  However, now (4 months later) I all of a sudden, I am experiencing blurry vision.  I only notice this when I try to read (especially in front of the computer or when trying to take notes in class) - its to the point where I have to actually squint to see my computer screen clearly.  I've been tested (3 months ago) for diabetes and bloodwork came back clear.  I don't know what this has to do with.  I've come up with 2 things that it might have to do with...1) the astigmatism or 2) Since my eyes improved and I ordered new contacts, I still had my old glasses and did not order new glasses because I only wear glasses rarely.  However, my glasses prescription was my old one (stronger prescription) and my contacts are my new prescription.  I wear my new contacts during the day and in the evenings sometimes I put my glasses on - could this have messed my eyes up since the glasses and contacts had different prescriptions?So those are the only two things that I could come up with.  Or can there be something seriously wrong?  I have made an eye appointment, but I want to get some more insight incase this doctor is not looking at all possibilities.Thanks.
title: Blurry vision problem
